content: AUCTION TERMSItem for Sale: 1 CI 10k Bits Coin- Coin is funded with .01BTC It’s also pre-fork so it includes BCH and many other forked coins Bid Format:  ".001BTC"  BTCStarting Bid: 0.01BTCBTCMinimum Bid Increment: 0.0001BTC BTCAuction End Time: Saturday December 9th- 6pm Eastern Standard Time (New York time)  Countdown Clock...https://www.timeanddate.com/countdown/generic?iso=20231209T18&p0=179&msg=CI+Auction+Countdown&font=serifSniping:  No sniping. 10 minute standard sniping rule. All lots extended with any bid to any lot...https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5277761.0 (sniping rules found here)Shipping: Paid for by buyer. Ships from USA. Buyer responsible for any and all customs/dutiesPayment Address: TBD (FYI- I WILL NEVER MESSAGE YOU OFF OF BITCOINTALK, DO NOT GET FOOLED BY A SCAMMER  Payment Due: Within 48 hoursEscrow: Available at cost of buyer

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Pretty cool idea to include an article from the coin encyclopedia. Is this the unserialized version then or if not, which serial does this one have? In any case, great piece of history.0.0127

comments.author: rsincognito
comments.body: Sorry if this is a dumb question, was this a coin/private key created by the creator of the coin or is it a DIY?

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: rsincognito on December 03, 2023, 12:20:33 AMSorry if this is a dumb question, was this a coin/private key created by the creator of the coin or is it a DIY?Based on the way the firstbits look in the hologram's window, I'd say it was legit from CI.

Is this the unserialized version then or if not, which serial does this one have? In any case, great piece of history.0.0127I do believe unserialized.Quote from: rsincognito on December 03, 2023, 12:20:33 AMSorry if this is a dumb question, was this a coin/private key created by the creator of the coin or is it a DIY?Not a dumb question. comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: I had a few CI coins and I realized that often the laser-marked serial is either very hard to read, or had degraded beyond recognition - Not to say this had one, I have no idea, but I did have a coin where I brought it up in the sales thread, just can't find where/when at the moment as there were so many.  Edit maybe Pedro himself can chime in here about this, IDK. @CryptoImperator  Edit 2 - 0.01275 BTC

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: owlcatz on December 03, 2023, 12:28:25 AMQuote from: rsincognito on December 03, 2023, 12:20:33 AMSorry if this is a dumb question, was this a coin/private key created by the creator of the coin or is it a DIY?Based on the way the firstbits look in the hologram's window, I'd say it was legit from CI.  Yes, the first bits appear to be genuine.The coin had a late load date though in 2016: https://mempool.space/address/1Kh8qzin5kFVn6y8wePhNBQsrdmKEhcTK4Might have been when the coin sold or was confirmed received by the original owner, as CI was noted to load coins after customer reception.Quote from: owlcatz on December 03, 2023, 02:15:05 AMI had a few CI coins and I realized that often the laser-marked serial is either very hard to read, or had degraded beyond recognition - Not to say this had one, I have no idea, but I did have a coin where I brought it up in the sales thread, just can't find where/when at the moment as there were so many.  I know there has been some talk of certain CI coins showing first-bits degradation over the years. Seemingly, may be just dependent on said coin/paper....  And have not heard of the lasered numbering showing signs of degradation, but anything is possible As long as the first-bits are readable, CI has released all addresses for their coins except the Rocket silvers, which most addresses are in the Master Maker Thread here:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2022902.msg58889653#msg58889653
